text: not all birds sing with their voices
some sing with their wings or tails
like this hummingbird it's recorded with
an acoustic camera that pinpoints see
the red where sound comes from or this
African broadville it seems to make a
call with its wings here it
so some Yale researchers went to Uganda
to find out for certain they recorded
the flight and sound of males as they
advertise themselves to females that
showed that the bird produced the call
on the downstroke of its wings later
they tested a wing and individual
feathers in a wind tunnel they narrowed
the source down to the flutter of two
feathers but why would birds evolve a
new way to sing when they already had a
perfectly good one hard to say female
broad bills like it maybe that's reason
enough
